messages.message: @Jessica Please find the HAR file shared by JPMC.

Can we please expedite the resolution here as this is happening in Production and users are unable to review the flow results.
cc: @arun @tamir @amber
@Jessica @Udit We had a call with customer and they confirmed that this is happening in UAT as well with the same solution. Please let us know if you need more information on this from JPMC.

Hey! Thanks for debugging yesterday Jessica!

@dg What env is this on? I’ll look into the HAR file and check it out. Also what versions if any does this need to be backported to?
This is JPMC production and UAT(24.04.34)
Thanks, will make this my priority today to fix!

Thanks @Udit - JPMC just sent me a note explaining the urgency behind this. Since it's in production, they're requesting an ETA for the fix. Let me know if there's anything i can tell them right now. I will keep my eye on this. Please also let me know if there's anything you need from me.
I will be telling JPMC that this is getting lots of internal attention and i will soon let them know next steps.
interesting, this is not a flow v3 solution?
right. this is flow v2 I believe. will confirm with customer

I see the issue now, its to do with checking if its flow v3 or v2 and this was changed sometime in the past so flow review is treating this like its flow v3 when it is not. I will start working on the fix!
Thanks @Udit. Do you have rough timeline on when we can provide the fix to customer?

I think release certification happens tomorrow. If i can get a fix merged in today, we can hit that. However, it would not have been tested much then. This is a type of bug that would be helpful if you could test on dogfood for me after its merged in with that solution you encountered it with

Solution is in a customer environment which will make that difficult, we can try to get the issue re-created locally if we have a good idea of the issue. This should occur for any v2 flow with document classification that is going through human review and having the classification changed?
yup, just any v2 flow that can switch its class essentially should have this bug
I will see if I can get a demo put together, providing we have a sandbox active that can edit/create v2 flows, or if we have an example v2 available somewhere already
I have an existing V2 metaflow with classifier from awhile back that I was able to confirm exhibits this bug on IB prod, mirroring to dogfood now and will share a link once it is available
Thanks, I'll try and get my PR merged in soon so we can test on dogfood sometime tonight with the fix in

Flow path https://dogfood.instabase.com/ben.chuba/Validations/fs/Instabase%20Drive/
Flow results path https://dogfood.instabase.com/apps/flow/review/results/ben.chuba/Validations/fs/Instaba[…]rive/V2/out/batch.ibflowresults?redirectOnFinish=dashboard (https://dogfood.instabase.com/apps/flow/review/results/ben.chuba/Validations/fs/Instabase%20Drive/V2/out/batch.ibflowresults?redirectOnFinish=dashboard)
Attached confirmation of the error
@Jessica PR here to review when you're online: https://github.com/instabase/instabase/pull/64971
Customer has also confirmed that this flow is a v2 flow
Its merged into master so we can test on dogfood this evening. The backport PR can be merged after that if it works on dogfood tonight after its updated.
Just confirmed it works on dogfood on the link you sent above! I'll try to get the backport merged early tomorrow morning before release cert!
Thanks @Udit
